Binary¶

class binary.BinaryOutcomeModel(add_intercept: bool = False, compute_statistics: bool = True, bootstrap_marginal_effect_variances: bool = False)¶

A binary outcome model that Logit and Probit are built on

bootstrap(X: numpy.ndarray)¶

Implement bootstrap method for marginal effect variance computation for Logit and Probit Bootstrap variance of marginal effects (X (n x k)) Output: (n x k) - variances for k marginal effects for the n observations

compute_marginal_effects(X: numpy.ndarray, beta: numpy.ndarray)¶

Calculate marginal effects given X and beta

compute_statistics()¶

Compute standard error

delta_method()¶

Implement delta method for marginal effect variance computation for Logit or Probit

fit(X: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray)¶

Fit binary model, using the BFGS algorithm for MLE (minimize the negative log-likelihood)

get_covariance_matrix()¶

Compute covariance matrix for the parameters The asymptotical variance is the inverse information matrix

get_dummy_columns()¶

refresh dummy_columns list - tells which column in X is dummy variable, which one is continuous

get_marginal_effect_variances(X: numpy.ndarray)¶

Calculate variance of marginal effects X (n x k) Output: (n x k) - variances for k marginal effects for the n observations

get_marginal_effects(X: numpy.ndarray, variances: bool = True)¶

Calculate marginal effects X (n x k) - must follow the structure of X Output: (n x k) - k marginal effects for the n observations

variances: - variances for the (n x k) marginal effects -> return (marginals, var_marginals)

information()¶

Implement Fisher Information matrix computation

link_function()¶

Implement link function for Logit or Probit

link_function_derivative()¶

Implement the derivative link function for Logit or Probit

objective_function(beta: numpy.ndarray)¶

negative log likelihood

predict(X)¶

Predict probability: Pr(y=1|x) return y_hat and Pr(y=1|x)

score()¶

Implement objective function derivative

class binary.Logit(**kwargs)¶

Fit logit

delta_method(X: numpy.ndarray)¶

Calculate variance of marginal effects (X (n x k)) Output: (n x k) - variances for k marginal effects for the n observations

information()¶

Compute Fisher information matrix

link_function(X: numpy.ndarray, beta: numpy.ndarray)¶

probit or logit, can be used for prediction, so does not use self.X as default

link_function_derivative(X: numpy.ndarray, beta: numpy.ndarray)¶

The derivative of the link function

score(beta: numpy.ndarray)¶

Return the first derivative of the objective function at beta

class binary.Probit(**kwargs)¶

Fit probit

delta_method(X: numpy.ndarray)¶

Calculate variance of marginal effects (X (n x k)) Output: (n x k) - variances for k marginal effects for the n observations

information()¶

Compute Fisher information matrix

link_function(X: numpy.ndarray, beta: numpy.ndarray)¶

probit -> standard normal distribution, can be used for prediction, so does not use self.X as default

The derivative of the link function
